2026-02-18.content:
New best practices are available for securing generative AI agents using Model
Context Protocol (MCP) with Google Cloud databases. This guide covers key
security measures like least privilege, native database controls, and secure
agent design to help you build safer AI applications. For more information, see
[Best practices for securing agent interactions with Model Context Protocol](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/secure-agent-interactions-mcp).

summary.title: Secure Generative AI Agents
summary.summary: New best practices guide you on securing generative AI agents with Model Context Protocol (MCP) on Google Cloud databases. Learn about least privilege, native database controls, and secure agent design to build safer AI applications.

2026-02-18.content:
You can migrate a machine learning feature management workload from Vertex AI
Feature Store (Legacy) to a Bigtable instance. For more information, see
[Migrate from Vertex AI Feature Store (Legacy) to
Bigtable](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/migrate-vertex-ai-legacy-bigtable).

summary.title: Feature management migration to Bigtable
summary.summary: You can now migrate your machine learning feature management workloads from Vertex AI Feature Store (Legacy) to Bigtable. This allows for more flexible and scalable feature management. Refer to the documentation for detailed migration steps.

2026-02-17.content:
You can use the [Bigtable Admin API MCP server](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/use-bigtable-mcp)
to enable agents and AI applications to perform a range of data-related tasks.
This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Bigtable Admin API MCP Server Available
summary.summary: The Bigtable Admin API MCP server is now available, allowing agents and AI applications to perform various data-related tasks. This feature is currently in Preview.

2026-02-13.content:
You can use the [Flink Bigtable connector](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/flink-connector)
version 0.3.2 to connect to Bigtable from Apache Flink version 2.1.0.
Additionally, this version of the connector lets you specify the number of
mutations to include in each batch sent to Bigtable. This feature is
[generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Flink connector for Bigtable now available
summary.summary: The Flink connector for Bigtable is now generally available. Version 0.3.2 supports Apache Flink 2.1.0 and allows you to specify the number of mutations per batch for improved performance.

2026-01-30.content:
Bigtable has a unified, customizable system insights dashboard. This dashboard
includes predefined metrics and other Google Cloud metrics. This
feature is [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).
For more information, see [Customize the system insights dashboard](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/monitoring-instance#customize-system-insights).

summary.title: Bigtable system insights dashboard now available
summary.summary: Bigtable now offers a unified and customizable system insights dashboard. This feature, which is generally available, includes predefined and other Google Cloud metrics to help you monitor your instance.

2026-01-21.content:
Bigtable is available in the `asia-southeast3` (Bangkok) region. For more
information, see [Bigtable locations](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/locations).

summary.title: Bigtable now in Bangkok
summary.summary: Bigtable is now available in the asia-southeast3 (Bangkok) region. This expansion brings Bigtable's high-performance NoSQL database closer to customers in Southeast Asia, improving latency and data locality.

2025-12-26.content:
Continuous materialized views support up to five continuous materialized views
per table. This lets you create multiple asynchronous secondary indexes on a
table or have a mix of precomputed aggregate views and asynchronous secondary
indexes on the same base table. For more information, see
[Continuous materialized views](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/continuous-materialized-views).

summary.title: Multiple Continuous Materialized Views
summary.summary: You can now create up to five continuous materialized views per table. This feature allows for multiple asynchronous secondary indexes or a mix of precomputed aggregate and asynchronous secondary indexes on the same base table.

2025-12-12.content:
In the Google Cloud console, you can import data into Bigtable using the
[Dataflow job builder](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/guides/job-builder),
a web interface for building and running Dataflow pipelines. This integration
provides a pre-populated template to import data from Pub/Sub to Bigtable. You
can also create a custom job to import data from other sources. For more
information, see [Import and export data](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/import-export).

summary.title: Import data to Bigtable easily
summary.summary: You can now import data into Bigtable directly from the Google Cloud console using the Dataflow job builder. This feature offers a pre-built template for importing data from Pub/Sub, with the flexibility to create custom jobs for other data sources.

2025-11-03.content: You can use protocol buffer (protobuf) schemas to query individual fields within protobuf messages stored as bytes in Bigtable. First, [create and manage your protobuf schemas](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/create-manage-protobuf-schemas). Then, [query your protobuf data](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/query-protobuf-data) using GoogleSQL for Bigtable or BigQuery external tables. This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products?e=48754805&hl=en#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Query Protobuf Data in Bigtable
summary.summary: You can now query individual fields within protobuf messages in Bigtable using protobuf schemas. This feature, currently in Preview, supports GoogleSQL for Bigtable and BigQuery external tables.

2025-10-28.content: You can use Cloud KMS Autokey in the Google Cloud console to automate the creation and use of [customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK)](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/cmek) in Bigtable clusters.

summary.title: Cloud KMS Autokey for Bigtable
summary.summary: Automate the creation and use of customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK) in Bigtable clusters using Cloud KMS Autokey directly within the Google Cloud console.

2025-10-27.content:
Bigtable provides vector and key-value store integrations for LangChain, an LLM orchestration framework.
For more information, see [Build LLM-powered applications using LangChain](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/langchain) and [Perform Maximal Marginal Relevance search with LangChain on Bigtable](https://docs.cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/mmr-vector-search).

summary.title: Bigtable Integrates with LangChain
summary.summary: LangChain, an LLM orchestration framework, now supports Bigtable for both vector and key-value storage.

summary.title: Bigtable JDBC driver now in Preview

2025-10-06.content: You can optimize storage with Bigtable [tiered storage](https://cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/tiered-storage), reduce storage costs, and retain data for longer. This feature is available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

2025-05-29.content:
The [Bigtable Spark connector](https://cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/use-bigtable-spark-connector) supports Scala versions 2.12 and 2.13 in all connector versions and has been updated as follows:

* Connector versions 0.5.0 and later support [dynamic columns](https://github.com/GoogleCloudDataproc/spark-bigtable-connector?tab=readme-ov-file#catalog-with-variable-column-definitions).
* Connector versions 0.6.0 and later support [custom authentication providers](https://github.com/GoogleCloudDataproc/spark-bigtable-connector/?tab=readme-ov-file#how-do-i-authenticate-outside-gce--dataproc) and [efficient joins with data sources](https://github.com/GoogleCloudDataproc/spark-bigtable-connector/?tab=readme-ov-file#efficient-joins-with-other-data-sources).

summary.title: Bigtable Spark Connector Updates
summary.summary: The Bigtable Spark connector now supports Scala versions 2.12 and 2.13. Recent updates include support for dynamic columns in version 0.5.0 and later, and custom authentication providers along with efficient joins in version 0.6.0 and later.

2025-05-27.content: You can delete logical and continuous materialized views in the Google Cloud console. For more information, see [Delete a logical view](https://cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/create-manage-logical-views#delete) or [Delete a continuous materialized view](https://cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/manage-continuous-materialized-views#delete).

summary.title: Manage Materialized Views in Google Cloud Console
